data.title: vec3 variants for toLinear and toGamma
TSStaicShape::changeMaterial() UV Wrong
data.body: I created a new TSSTatic, assigned it a shapeName, then called changeMaterial() according to the TS manual.  The texture UVs are wrong.

data.title: accutex was left out of the copy constructor for TSRenderState.
data.body: caused issues with https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/1711

data.title: Feature request: Better lightmap functionality
data.body:
The current system of lightmapping in T3D is not very practical to use, since you need to add the lightmap into each slot of each material that your shape uses, which creates several  big problems:
1. You cannot reuse materials, since each material is only limited to one shape and I for example have materials that are reused over the game. So you would need to create a new material each time you reuse textures.
2. You cannot reuse shapes in different scenes, since the lightmap is fixed to the conditions they have been made for, so for each scene you would need to create a new shape with a new material to meet the new lighting conditions.
3. You have to setup each shape and each material by hand.

The idea I have will fix all that. My idea is to automatically add a lightmap, if available by providing a specific texture for it. So you would need to create a lightmap UV in the second UV channel for all your objects, bake the lightmap in modeling program and then export it, in Torque3D you would just add the lightmap for the model by naming it a specific way to indicate it is the lightmap for that shape.
Like with the terrain, where you have theTerrain.ter and theTerrain_basetex.dds then you would have myModel.dae and myModel_lightmap.dds and the engine would automatically apply it to the shape avoiding to having to use the material system. You could also setup multiple lightmaps for each scene light myModel_lightmap_scene1.dds, myModel_lightmap_scene2.dds etc. For control over it, you could have a checkbox for whether to use lightmap yes/no and which one to use and maybe an intensity slider and this would fix all the issues I named and make it overall more easy to use.

data.title: Spaces in font names
data.body:
I noticed that font names have been changed from "Arial Bold" into "ArialBold" in some places. Someone told me that is to prevent cross platform issues, since other systems have problems with spaces in filenames.
My Question now is, why only a few names got changed and a bunch of cases in the game template are left where it still says "Arial Bold".
Another problem I see is that the filenames created by the font caching systems still contain spaces, like before it was "Arial Bold 14 (ansi).uft" and now it is "ArialBold 14 (ansi).uft" so only one space was removed and the spaces between the size number are still there.
So my question is now, is this correct, or did I misunderstood something there?

data.title: Terrain materials are double sided
data.body:
I noticed when I fly under the terrain, it is still visible, this means the terrain materials are all double sided and this cannot be changed, since terrain materials, do not have the value to change if they are double sided or not.
Since double sided materials cost more to render, the terrain should not be double sided.
I also checked one version before and the terrain materials were all single sided like it should be, so they got broken in 3.9 update.

data.title: Ugly fog banding
data.body:
When the fog is a bit heavier and  the fog offset relatively close to the player you can see quite strong ugly banding effects where the fog is not smooth close to the player:
http://duion.com/files/temp/screenshot_TG_Fields_rain007-00001.png

data.title: Decals appear double from the distance
data.body:
I noticed since 3.9 when you zoom in on decals from the distance they appear double like that:
Closeup:
http://duion.com/files/temp/screenshot_TG_BuildingSite_day006-00000.png
Zoomed from far:
http://duion.com/files/temp/screenshot_TG_BuildingSite_day006-00001.png

data.title: LOD detail levels wrong
data.body:
It looks like the LODing is much stronger since version 3.9 it is at least double that agressive, maybe even 4 times.
I had setup all my models so the LOD popping is hardly visible far in the distance, now I constantly see models popping right infront of me, if I set the settings to lowest there is even whole forests disappearing  right infront of me.
So there must be something seriously wrong with that. Maybe the pixel distance to determine how big the objects are is wrong or the detail adjust rate from $pref::TS::detailAdjust

data.body: Seems like the zOffset feature for the scatterSky is broken in case anyone cares.

data.title: changes "Rotation" instead of "rotation" #1702
data.body: Changes back "Rotation =" values in mission files to the old "rotation =" since all other values are also lowercase.

data.title: Change back "enabled" values to lowercase
data.body:
I noticed in 3.9 when opening and re-saving my mission files that all values that had "enabled = 1" written in the datablock like the spawnSpheres were changed to "Enabled =1" instead.
This changes it back to produce lowercase output.
Don't know if this is the right way, but it works, it disturbed me a bit in my version control that every mission I touched was updated with hundreds of changes on "enabled" into "Enabled" while all other entries are lowercase.

data.title: adresses #1704: partial reversion to 3.8 specs regarding layer blending.
No footstep sounds when no impact sound ID set
data.body:
I noticed that some of my materials do not have footstep sounds anymore and after some experimentation I found out, that those materials that did not have an impact sound ID set as well, did not make footstep sounds.
The impact sound ID did not affect what footstep is played, it just needs any ID set to there for the footsteps to play, this was not like that before 3.9

data.title: setTurretEulerRotation does not work
data.body: if you do setTurretEulerRotation then getTurretEulerRotation it shows that things have changed but the model does nothing

data.title: Shadow lags behind with sun object
data.body: When I use the basic sun object instead of scattersky, which I have to do in a level where I use a skybox, then the shadow of my player extremely lags behind, it feels like the game is just running at 5 fps according to the shadow, but the rest runs fine.

data.title: Tweaks the detail textures for the terrain
data.body: Tweaks the detail textures for the terrain to work better with the linear pipeline.

data.title: 3.9 fix: corrects improperly applied specularpower
data.body:
on the hlsl side: corrects improperly applied specularpower (slider in conjunction with cubemap). 
gl side kills a redundant test

data.title: Hard edges on terrain where terrain textures appearance changes
data.body:
Additional to the terrain textures being wrong I noticed that on certain tiles in the map, the terrain rendering suddenly is different. There is a straight line without blending and inside that tile the textures look more like they looked originally while around they are like the 3.9 high contrasty wrong textures.
So it is hard to adjust them if there is those tiles where everything is different.
Here are some example screenshots:
http://duion.com/files/temp/screenshot_TG_DesertRuins_day001-00003.png
http://duion.com/files/temp/screenshot_TG_BuildingSite_day001-00004.png
http://duion.com/files/temp/screenshot_TG_BuildingSite_day001-00007.png

I found out that the seam goes away, if I disable the macro texture, so it is related to that likely.

data.title: Terrain textures intensity wrong
data.body:
After 3.9 upgrade I noticed all my terrain textures being totally wrong in contrast, brightness, saturation etc.
This is how it looked before:
http://duion.com/files/temp/screenshot_001-00000.png
This is how it looked after updating to 3.9:
http://duion.com/files/temp/screenshot_TG_DirtPit_day001-00000.png

After a bit of testing I found out that the intensity is roughly doubled, so if I changed the detail texture intensity to 0.5 instead of 1 it was closer to the original result, but there are still macro maps and base maps that also need changing.
So it would be nice if this can be changed back in code to produce halfway similar results than before, it does not look like a good option to change every texture to 0.5 intensity instead of 1 since the textures used already look correct, they have on average even less contrast than regular textures already, so we don't need an algorithm that increases contrast inside the engine even more.
